intro: Ocotea uxpanapana, commonly known as the Mexican laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to southern Mexico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces drupes that are often used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Ocotea uxpanapana make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
